str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To remind, admonish, be reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall. From ana and mimnesko; to remind; to recollect.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Of Hebrew origin; my master, i.e Rabbi, as an official title of honor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fig-tree. From sukon; a fig-tree.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To curse. Middle voice from katara; to execrate; by analogy, to doom.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dry up, parch, be ripened, wither, waste away. From xeros; to desiccate; by implication, to shrivel, to mature.
